chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose E Alvarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3.5 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.

Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week for the first year of probation and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Presentence credit is to be applied to conditional time.  After serving 7 months, defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion, balance of jail time is STAYED and defendant must complete all recommended continuing care under the supervision of the Department of Corrections. **CORRECTED 5/3/18 TO CHANGE CREDIT FROM 107 DAYS TO 104 DAYS**

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Jose E Alvarez in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Jose E Alvarez in custody.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, MAB (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   No contact with St. Mary's Medical Center/hospital.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jose E Alvarez in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Jose E Alvarez in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
